p: Lewandowsky, Gignac and Oberauer’s [ 52] 5-item scale was used to measure participants’ belief that human-caused climate change is occurring (example item: Human CO2 emissions cause climate change). Responses were captured on a 7-point Likert scale ranging from 1 ( Strongly disagree) to 7 ( Strongly agree). The scale displayed acceptable internal consistency (Cronbach’s α = .72) according to the criteria suggested by George and Mallery [ 53]. For comparison, Lewandowsky et al., report an α value of .78 for this scale.
